TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ChangeConflictCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<class System.Data.Linq.ObjectChangeConflict>, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.Data.Linq.ObjectChangeConflict>, class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Returns a collection of objects involved in concurrency conflicts.

remarks.format:
## Examples In the following example that retrieves information about objects in conflict, `db.ChangeConflicts` represents the collection of those objects.
[!code-cs[System.Data.Linq.ObjectChangeConflict#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/objconflict/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Data.Linq.ObjectChangeConflict#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/objconflict/module1.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Removes all conflicts from the collection.

## Remarks Copies the elements of the collection to an array.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.Linq.ChangeConflictCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.

Docs.summary: Returns the number of conflicts in the collection

MemberSignature.Value: public void ResolveAll (System.Data.Linq.RefreshMode mode, bool autoResolveDeletes);
.method public hidebysig instance void ResolveAll(valuetype System.Data.Linq.RefreshMode mode, bool autoResolveDeletes) cil managed

Docs.param: The strategy to use to resolve the conflict.
If true, automatically resolves conflicts that result from a modified object that is no longer in the database.
Docs.summary: Resolves all conflicts in the collection by using the specified strategy.
